channel.title: how to reuse circuit for curl?
channel.description: I want to access an account whose session is bound to the IP. If I use tor-browser it works adequately. using curl I can only login but the next request will use another Exit node. Is there a way to prevent that for this specific purpose?

item.title: how to reuse circuit for curl?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
brittani:

What do you mean by “but not fully”?

Because Tor will still keep changing Tor circuits as Tor is usually doing as per Tor defaults defined by The Tor Project torproject.org.

brittani:

would an adequate solution be creating a new socks port with a long circuit time dedicated to that login purpose?

Yes.

potential search engine search term:

Tor keep same circuit

Read full topic
item.source: how to reuse circuit for curl?

item.title: how to reuse circuit for curl?
item.dc:creator: brittani
item.description:
thanks for the quick response.
What do you mean by “but not fully”? The curl.anondist-orig version seems to do what is needed?

If I read correctly the request will go through the TransPort - would an adequate solution be creating a new socks port with a long circuit time dedicated to that login purpose?

Read full topic
item.source: how to reuse circuit for curl?

item.title: how to reuse circuit for curl?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Disabling stream isolation for curl might help a bit but not fully solve this. See:

Whonix – 2 Dec 21

Stream Isolation: Easy

Whonix ™ Tor Stream Isolation Short Introduction

Whonix – 26 Dec 20

Disable Stream Isolation: Easy

How to disable stream isolation. Easiest and most common methods only.

export UWT_DEV_PASSTHROUGH="1" curl ...

Or

curl.anondist-orig 38.229.72.22 curl ...

Other than that:

You could consider to resolve this as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle.

  1. check how to do that using Tor without use of Whonix
  2. then you might be able to replicate that using Tor in Whonix
Whonix – 2 Dec 21

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Read full topic
